title: 1721-D
statement: D. Maximum ANDtime limit per test3 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputYou are given two arrays $$$a$$$ and $$$b$$$, consisting of $$$n$$$ integers each.Let's define a function $$$f(a, b)$$$ as follows:let's define an array $$$c$$$ of size $$$n$$$, where $$$c_i = a_i \\oplus b_i$$$ ($$$\\oplus$$$ denotes bitwise XOR);the value of the function is $$$c_1 \\mathbin{\\&} c_2 \\mathbin{\\&} \\cdots \\mathbin{\\&} c_n$$$ (i.e. bitwise AND of the entire array $$$c$$$).Find the maximum value of the function $$$f(a, b)$$$ if you can reorder the array $$$b$$$ in an arbitrary way (leaving the initial order is also an option).InputThe first line contains one integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \\le t \\le 10^4$$$) — the number of test cases.The first line of each test case contains one integer $$$n$$$ ($$$1 \\le n \\le 10^5$$$) — the size of arrays $$$a$$$ and $$$b$$$.The second line contains $$$n$$$ integers $$$a_1, a_2, \\dots, a_n$$$ ($$$0 \\le a_i < 2^{30}$$$).The third line contains $$$n$$$ integers $$$b_1, b_2, \\dots, b_n$$$ ($$$0 \\le b_i < 2^{30}$$$).The sum of $$$n$$$ over all test cases does not exceed $$$10^5$$$.OutputFor each test case print one integer — the maximum value of the function $$$f(a, b)$$$ if you can reorder the array $$$b$$$ in an arbitrary way.ExampleInput351 0 0 3 32 3 2 1 031 1 10 0 380 1 2 3 4 5 6 77 6 5 4 3 2 1 0Output2 0 7

processed.result:
You are given two arrays,  'a' and 'b', each containing 'n' integers. 

For each pair of elements at the same index in the arrays, calculate their bitwise XOR (exclusive OR). This will create a new array 'c'.

Then, calculate the bitwise AND of all the elements in array 'c'.

Your task is to find the maximum possible value of this bitwise AND after you are allowed to rearrange the elements of array 'b' in any way you like.

Input:

* The first line contains 't' (the number of test cases).
* For each test case:
    * The first line contains 'n' (the size of the arrays).
    * The second line contains 'n' integers representing the elements of array 'a'.
    * The third line contains 'n' integers representing the elements of array 'b'.

Output:

For each test case, print the maximum possible value of the bitwise AND calculated as described above.

You have two lists of numbers.  You can rearrange the second list however you want.  For each position in the lists, calculate the bitwise XOR of the numbers at that position. Then, calculate the bitwise AND of all those results. What is the largest possible result you can get?
